descriptions.content:
The present tense is formed by placing after the verb the particles: གི་ཡོད་རེད་ (assertive), གི་འདུག་ (testimonial), and གི་ཡོད་ (egophoric). These are formed by adding an existential copula to the suffix གི་. The resulting auxiliaries have the same evidential value as the existential copulas. In modern conversational usage, the form གི་འདུག་ is often abbreviated to གིས་.

In English, these forms may be translated either by the progressive or the simple present depending on the context.

The various forms are presented in the following table:

Table: The Present Tense Auxiliaries

Affirmative

Interrogative

(without pronoun)

Interrogative

(with pronouns)

གི་ཡོད་མ་རེད་པས་

Some basic example sentences:

  • ང་ཁ་ལག་བཟོ་གི་ཡོད། “I am preparing the meal.” (or) “I prepare the meal.” (egophoric)
  • ང་ཡི་གེ་འབྲི་གི་ཡོད། “I am writing a letter.” (or) “I write letters.” (egophoric)
  • བློ་བཟང་ཁ་ལག་བཟོ་གི་ཡོད་རེད། “Lopzang prepares food.” (or) “Lopzang is preparing food.” (assertive)
  • བློ་བཟང་ཁ་ལག་བཟོ་གི་(འདུག) “Lopzang is preparing food.” (or) “Lopzang prepares food.” (testimonial)
  • རྡོ་རྗེ་ཡི་གེ་འབྲི་གི་ཡོད་རེད། “Dorjé writes letters.” (or) “Dorjé is writing a letter.” (assertive)
  • རྡོ་རྗེ་ཡི་གེ་འབྲི་གི་(འདུག) “Dorjé is writing a letter.” (or) “Dorjé writes letters.” (testimonial)
